intro: Calyptranthes cuneifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf calyptranthes, is a species of flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of Central America and parts of South America. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and small, clustered yellow flowers. It typically grows as an evergreen shrub or small tree, often found in humid, shaded environments. Calyptranthes cuneifolia is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in tropical gardens.
